title: Portugal on verge of collapse, euro crisis flares
teaser: Europe's financial crisis flared anew on Wednesday, after Portugal's finance minister quit and the government teetered on the edge of collapse.
contentencoded:
Europe's financial crisis flared anew on Wednesday, after Portugal's finance minister quit and the government teetered on the edge of collapse. Interest rates on Portuguese government bonds approached 8 percent.

The BBC's Alison Roberts joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio from Lisbon with the latest.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, July 3, 2013
